uk.ac.susx.mlcl.byblo.measures
Class AbstractMIProximity

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.susx.mlcl.byblo.measures.AbstractProximity
      uk.ac.susx.mlcl.byblo.measures.AbstractMIProximity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Proximity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Confusion, CosineMi, CrMi, DiceMi, Hindle, JaccardMi, Lin, RecallMi
public abstract class AbstractMIProximity
extends AbstractProximity

AbstractMIProximity is a class that mutual information (MI) based proximity measures can extend. Unlike more tradition measures (such as Jaccard) these require global feature statistical information, which is held in the class fields.

Author:
Hamish I A Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

protected final double featureFreq(int k)
Return the frequency of a particular feature, denoted by the index k.

Parameters:
k - The feature id (or dimension) to access
Returns:
The frequency of that feature over the whole corpus.

featurePrior

protected final double featurePrior(int k)
Return the independent probability of a particular feature, calculated as the frequency of the feature divided by the total number of features observed over the corpus.

Parameters:
k - the feature id (or dimension)
Returns:
independent probability of that feature occurring.

entryPrior

protected final double entryPrior(uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect.SparseDoubleVector V)

inf

protected final double inf(uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect.SparseDoubleVector V,
                           int i)

Calculate the information content of the vector V at dimension i with respect to the feature information held by this class.

If only the positive information is required then use posInf(null, featureCardinality) because it's faster.

Parameters:
V - vector
i - dimension (aka feature id) to calculate
Returns:
information content of V at i

posInf

protected final double posInf(uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect.SparseDoubleVector V,
                              int i)
Calculate the positive information given by the vector V at dimension i with respect to the feature information held by this class. If the information content is negative then 0 is returned.

Parameters:
V - vector
i - dimension (aka feature id) to calculate
Returns:
information content of V at i if positive, otherwise 0
